alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 2:23AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW PRODUCING SLICK TRAVEL FOR SIERRA PASSES FRIDAY MORNING... A weak storm system will move quickly across the Sierra and northeast California through Friday, bringing gusty southwest winds and a period of snow capable of producing travel impacts and delays across Sierra crest passes for the Friday morning commute. * Winds: Most of the stronger winds will remain in higher elevations, with ridge level gusts 65-75 mph today. For lower elevations, wind gusts of 25-35 mph are expected. * Snow: Peak snowfall rates are expected through 10 AM. Sierra passes including Fredonyer Summit, Yuba Pass, Donner and Echo summits, and Carson Pass could see 3-6 inches. Lighter amounts up to 2 inches are possible across the remainder of the Lake Tahoe Basin and NE California west of US-395 above 5500 feet. If traveling across the Sierra Friday morning, be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. Conditions are expected to improve in the afternoon through the remainder of Friday as the snow diminishes to scattered snow showers and higher April sun angles allow snow to melt on paved surfaces.

area.areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties
